entry.et: Middle English us, from Anglo-French, from Latin usus, from uti to use

def.dt: :the act or practice of employing something :employment application he made good use of his spare time
:the fact or state of being used a dish in daily use
:a method or manner of employing or applying something gained practice in the use of the camera
:habitual or customary usage
:an individual habit or group custom
:a liturgical form or observance
:a liturgy having modifications peculiar to a local church or religious order
:the privilege or benefit of using something gave him the use of her car
:the ability or power to use something (as a limb or faculty)
:the legal enjoyment of property that consists in its employment, occupation, exercise, or practice she had the use of the estate for life
:a particular service or end put learning to practical use
:the quality of being suitable for employment saving things that might be of use
:good 2b it's no use arguing
:the occasion or need to employ took only what they had use for
:the benefit in law of one or more persons
:the benefit or profit of property established in one other than the legal possessor
:a legal arrangement by which such benefits and profits are so established
:a favorable attitude :liking had no use for modern art

in.pr: ˈyüzd, in the phrase “used to” usually ˈyüs(t)

def.dt: :accustom habituate
:to put into action or service :avail oneself of :employ
:to consume or take (as liquor or drugs) regularly
:to carry out a purpose or action by means of :utilize
:manipulate 2b used him selfishly
:to expend or consume by putting to use often used with up
:to behave toward :act with regard to :treat used the prisoners cruelly
:stand 1d the house could use a coat of paint

dt.un: used in the past with to to indicate a former fact or state we used to go more often didn't use to smoke

def.dt: :to take illicit drugs regularly

entry.pt: use employ utilize mean to put into service especially to attain an end. use implies availing oneself of something as a means or instrument to an end willing to use any means to achieve her ends. employ suggests the use of a person or thing that is available but idle, inactive, or disengaged looking for better ways to employ their skills. utilize may suggest the discovery of a new, profitable, or practical use for something an old wooden bucket utilized as a planter.

def.dt: :to exhaust of strength or useful properties land that has been used up

:a legal doctrine that portions of copyrighted materials may be used without permission of the copyright owner provided the use is fair and reasonable, does not substantially impair the value of the materials, and does not curtail the profits reasonably expected by the owner
:to use badly :maltreat abuse
:used or suitable for several different functions a mixed–use building
